boat.full_description:
Her first owner was Whilloughby John Bean, an East Coast landowner who also owned Clacton Pier and used her as a pleasure boat for the pier. She was registered for fishing in 1905. Frederick Westhorpe Mole fished her as CK46. Frederick was killed when the naval stores ship Industry was torpedoed in the Irish Sea 18 October 1918. After the war she was bought but the Pitt family and fished out of Maldon as MN4.

She won the West Mersea Town Cup in 1938. She fished until the 1950's when she was taken out of fishing and used as a floating pontoon. David Wager purchased her as a wreck dug from the mud in Essex and re-built her 1997-2003. He has cruised her to Amsterdam and to Brest.
boat.name: Skylark
boat.short_description: Built as a pleasure boat for Clacton Pier, she was registered for fishing in 1905 and fished up until the 1950's.
